00049 // struct stat {
00050 //    dev_t     st_dev;      /* device */
00051 //    ino_t     st_ino;      /* inode */
00052 //    mode_t    st_mode;     /* protection */
00053 //    nlink_t   st_nlink;    /* number of hard links */
00054 //    uid_t     st_uid;      /* user ID of owner */
00055 //    gid_t     st_gid;      /* group ID of owner */
00056 //    dev_t     st_rdev;     /* device type (if inode device) */
00057 //    off_t     st_size;     /* total size, in bytes */
00058 //    blksize_t st_blksize;  /* blocksize for filesystem I/O */
00059 //    blkcnt_t  st_blocks;   /* number of blocks allocated */
00060 //    time_t    st_atime;    /* time of last access */
00061 //    time_t    st_mtime;    /* time of last modification */
00062 //    time_t    st_ctime;    /* time of last change */
00063 // };
00064

00114                 {
00115                 U_TRACE(0, "UFile::reset()")
00116 
00117                 fd       = -1;

00119                 st_size  = 0;

00125         UFile()
00126                 {
00127                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UFile, "", 0)
00128 
00129                 fd = -1;
00130 
00131                 path_relativ = 0;
00132 
00133                 inc_num_file_object();
00134                 }

00136         UFile(const UString& path) : pathname(path) 
00137                 {
00138                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UFile, "%.*S", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(path))
00139 
00140                 setPathRelativ();
00141 
00142                 inc_num_file_object();
00143                 }
00144 
00145         ~UFile()
00146                 {
00147                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, UFile)
00148 
00149                 dec_num_file_object();
00150 
00151 #  ifdef DEBUG
00152                 if (fd != -1) U_WARNING("file descriptor %d not closed...", fd);
00153 #  endif
00154                 }

00166         bool isPathRelativ(const UString& name) const
00167                 {
00168                 U_TRACE(0, "UFile::isPathRelativ(%.*S)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(name))
00169 
00170                 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("path_relativ(%u) = %.*S", path_relativ_len, path_relativ_len, path_relativ)
00171 
00172                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(path_relativ)
00173                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MAJOR(path_relativ_len, 0)
00174 
00175                 bool result = name.equal(path_relativ, path_relativ_len);
00176 
00177                 U_RETURN(result);
00178                 }
00179 
00180         const char* getSuffix() const
00181                 {
00182                 U_TRACE(0, "UFile::getSuffix()")
00183 
00184                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(path_relativ)
00185 
00186                 const char* ptr = (const char*) memrchr(path_relativ, '.', path_relativ_len);
00187 
00188                 U_RETURN(ptr);
00189                 }

00195         static int open(const char* pathname, int flags, mode_t mode)
00196                 {
00197                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::open(%S,%d,%d)", pathname, flags, mode)
00198 
00199                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(pathname)
00200                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MAJOR(strlen(pathname), 0)
00201 
00202                 int fd = U_SYSCALL(open, "%S,%d,%d", U_PATH_CONV(pathname), flags | O_CLOEXEC | O_BINARY, mode);
00203 
00204                 U_RETURN(fd);
00205                 }
00206 
00207         static int creat(const char* pathname, int flags = O_TRUNC | O_RDWR, mode_t mode = PERM_FILE)
00208                 {
00209                 U_TRACE(0, "UFile::creat(%S,%d,%d)", pathname, flags, mode)
00210 
00211                 return open(pathname, flags | O_CREAT, mode);
00212                 }

00214         static void close(int fd)
00215                 {
00216                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::close(%d)", fd)
00217 
00218                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_DIFFERS(fd, -1)
00219 
00220 #       ifdef __MINGW32__
00221                 (void) U_SYSCALL(_close, "%d", fd);
00222 #       else
00223                 (void) U_SYSCALL( close, "%d", fd);
00224 #       endif
00225                 }

00295         bool access(int mode = R_OK | X_OK)
00296                 {
00297                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::access(%d)", mode)
00298 
00299                 U_CHECK_MEMORY
00300 
00301                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(path_relativ)
00302 
00303                 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("path_relativ(%u) = %.*S", path_relativ_len, path_relativ_len, path_relativ)
00304 
00305                 bool result = (U_SYSCALL(access, "%S,%d", U_PATH_CONV(path_relativ), mode) == 0);
00306 
00307                 U_RETURN(result);
00308                 }

00310         bool stat()
00311                 {
00312                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::stat()")
00313

00317 
00318                 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("path_relativ(%u) = %.*S", path_relativ_len, path_relativ_len, path_relativ)
00319 
00320                 bool result = (U_SYSCALL(stat, "%S,%p", U_PATH_CONV(path_relativ), (struct stat*)this) == 0);
00321 
00322                 U_RETURN(result);
00323                 }

00356                 {

00358 
00359                 U_CHECK_MEMORY
00360

00367 
00368         void readSize()
00369                 {
00370                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::readSize()")
00371 
00372                 U_CHECK_MEMORY
00373 
00374                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_DIFFERS(fd, -1)
00375                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_EQUALS(st_size, 0)
00376                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(path_relativ)
00377 
00378                 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("path_relativ(%u) = %.*S", path_relativ_len, path_relativ_len, path_relativ)
00379 
00380                 st_size = lseek(U_SEEK_BEGIN, SEEK_END);
00381 
00382                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT(st_size >= U_SEEK_BEGIN)
00383                 }

00440         // Etag (HTTP/1.1)
00441 
00442         UString etag() const
00443                 {
00444                 U_TRACE(0, "UFile::etag()")
00445 
00446                 U_CHECK_MEMORY
00447 
00448                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MAJOR(st_size, 0)
00449                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_DIFFERS(st_ino, 0)
00450 
00451                 UString etag(100U);
00452 
00453                 // NB: The only format constraints are that the string be quoted...
00454 
00455                 etag.snprintf("\"%x-%x-%x\"", st_ino, st_size, st_mtime);
00456 
00457                 U_RETURN_STRING(etag);
00458                 }

00465 
00466                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MAJOR(st_size, 0)

00470                 }

00472         // MODIFIER
00473 
00474         bool modified()
00475                 {
00476                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::modified()")
00477 
00478                 time_t mtime = st_mtime;
00479 
00480                 fstat();
00481 
00482                 U_RETURN(mtime != st_mtime);
00483                 }
00484 
00485         static bool isBlocking(int fd, int& flags) // actual state is blocking...?
00486                 {
00487                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::isBlocking(%d,%d)", fd, flags)
00488 
00489                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_DIFFERS(fd, -1)
00490 
00491                 if (flags == -1) flags = U_SYSCALL(fcntl, "%d,%d,%d", fd, F_GETFL, 0);
00492 
00493                 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("O_NONBLOCK = %B, flags = %B", O_NONBLOCK, flags)
00494 
00495                 bool blocking = ((flags & O_NONBLOCK) != O_NONBLOCK);
00496 
00497                 U_RETURN(blocking);
00498                 }
00499

00508         static bool unlink(const char* pathname)
00509                 {
00510                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::unlink(%S)", pathname)
00511 
00512 #  ifdef __MINGW32__
00513                 bool result = (U_SYSCALL(unlink_w32, "%S", U_PATH_CONV(pathname)) == 0);
00514 #  else
00515                 bool result = (U_SYSCALL(unlink,     "%S",                               pathname)  == 0);
00516 #  endif
00517 
00518                 U_RETURN(result);
00519                 }

00561         // MEMORY MAPPED I/O
00562 
00563         static char* mmap(size_t length,
00564                                                         int fd = -1,
00565                                                         int prot = PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE,
00566                                                         int flags = MAP_SHARED | MAP_ANONYMOUS,
00567                                                         off_t offset = 0)
00568                 {
00569                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::mmap(%lu,%d,%d,%d,%I)", length, fd, prot, flags, offset)
00570 
00571 #  ifndef HAVE_ARCH64
00572                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_RANGE(1UL,length,3UL*1024UL*1024UL*1024UL) // limit of linux system
00573 #  endif
00574 
00575                 char* map = (char*) U_SYSCALL(mmap, "%d,%lu,%d,%d,%d,%I", 0, length, prot, flags, fd, offset);
00576 
00577                 return map;
00578                 }

00601         static void msync(char* ptr, char* page, int flags = MS_SYNC); // flushes changes made to memory mapped file back to disk
00602 
00603         // mremap expands (or shrinks) an existing memory  mapping, potentially moving it at the same time
00604         // (controlled by the flags argument and the available virtual address space)
00605 
00606         static void* mremap(void* old_address, size_t old_size, size_t new_size, int flags = 0) // MREMAP_MAYMOVE == 1
00607                 {
00608                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::mremap(%p,%lu,%lu,%d)", old_address, old_size, new_size, flags)
00609 
00610                 void* result = U_SYSCALL(mremap, "%p,%lu,%lu,%d", old_address, old_size, new_size, flags);
00611 
00612                 U_RETURN(result);
00613                 }

00617         char* eof() const
00618                 {
00619                 U_TRACE(0, "UFile::eof()")
00620 
00621                 U_CHECK_MEMORY
00622 
00623                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_DIFFERS(map, MAP_FAILED)
00624 
00625                 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("st_size = %I map_size = %u", st_size, map_size)
00626 
00627                 char* result = map + (st_size ? st_size : map_size);
00628 
00629                 U_RETURN(result);
00630                 }

00645         static bool pread(int fd, void* buf, size_t count, off_t offset)
00646                 {
00647                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::pread(%d,%p,%lu,%I)", fd, buf, count, offset)
00648 
00649                 bool result = (U_SYSCALL(pread, "%d,%p,%lu,%I", fd, buf, count, offset) == (ssize_t)count);
00650 
00651                 U_RETURN(result);
00652                 }

00657 
00658                 bool result = (U_SYSCALL(pwrite, "%d,%p,%lu,%I", fd, buf, count, offset) == (ssize_t)count);
00659 
00660                 U_RETURN(result);

00677         static bool stat(const char* path, struct stat* buf)
00678                 {
00679                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::stat(%S,%p)", path, buf)
00680 
00681                 bool result = (U_SYSCALL(stat, "%S,%p", U_PATH_CONV(path), buf) == 0);
00682 
00683                 U_RETURN(result);
00684                 }
00685 
00686         static bool write(int fd, const void* buf, size_t count)
00687                 {
00688                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::write(%d,%p,%lu)", fd, buf, count)
00689 
00690                 bool result = (U_SYSCALL(write, "%d,%p,%lu", fd, buf, count) == (ssize_t)count);
00691 
00692                 U_RETURN(result);
00693                 }

00704         int writev(const struct iovec* iov, int n) const
00705                 {
00706                 U_TRACE(0, "UFile::writev(%p,%d)", iov, n)
00707 
00708                 U_CHECK_MEMORY
00709 
00710                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_DIFFERS(fd, -1)
00711                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(path_relativ)
00712 
00713                 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("path_relativ(%u) = %.*S", path_relativ_len, path_relativ_len, path_relativ)
00714 
00715                 int result = UFile::writev(fd, iov, n);
00716 
00717                 U_RETURN(result);
00718                 }

00735 #  endif

00754                 {

00756

00770         /*
00771         Expands all symbolic links and resolves references to '/./', '/../' and extra '/' characters in the null
00772         terminated string named by path and stores the canonicalized absolute pathname in the return string.
00773         The resulting string will have no symbolic link, '/./' or '/../' components
00774         */
00775 
00776         static UString getRealPath(const char* path);

00778         // TEMP FILES
00779 
00780                          bool mkTemp(const char* _tmpl = "lockXXXXXX");  // temporary  file for locking...
00781         static bool mkTempStorage(UString& space, off_t size); // temporary space for upload file...
00782 
00783         // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00784         // create a unique temporary file
00785         // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00786         // char pathname[] = "/tmp/dataXXXXXX"
00787         // The last six characters of template must be XXXXXX and these are replaced with a string that makes the filename unique
00788         // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00789 
00790         static int mkstemp(char* _template)
00791                 {
00792                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::mkstemp(%S)", _template)
00793 
00794                 errno = 0; // mkstemp may not set it on error
00795 
00796                 int fd = U_SYSCALL(mkstemp, "%S", U_PATH_CONV(_template));
00797 
00798                 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("_template = %S", _template)
00799 
00800                 U_RETURN(fd);
00801                 }
00802 
00803         // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00804         // mkdtemp - create a unique temporary directory
00805         // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00806         // The mkdtemp() function generates a uniquely-named temporary directory from template. The last six characters
00807         // of template must be XXXXXX and these are replaced with a string that makes the directory name unique.
00808         // The directory is then created with permissions 0700. Since it will be modified, template must not be a string
00809         // constant, but should be declared as a character array.
00810         // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00811 
00812         static bool mkdtemp(UString& _template);
00813 
00814         /*
00815         sendfile() copies data between one file descriptor and another. Either or both of these file descriptors may refer to a socket.
00816         OUT_FD should be a descriptor opened for writing. POFFSET is a pointer to a variable holding the input file pointer position from
00817         which sendfile() will start reading data. When sendfile() returns, this variable will be set to the offset of the byte following
00818         the last byte that was read. COUNT is the number of bytes to copy between file descriptors. Because this copying is done within
00819         the kernel, sendfile() does not need to spend time transferring data to and from user space.
00820         */
00821 
00822         bool sendfile(int out_fd, off_t* poffset = 0, size_t count = 0)
00823                 {
00824                 U_TRACE(1, "UFile::sendfile(%d,%p,%lu)", out_fd, poffset, count)
00825 
00826                 U_CHECK_MEMORY
00827 
00828                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_DIFFERS(fd, -1)
00829                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MAJOR(st_size, 0)
00830                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(path_relativ)
00831 
00832                 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("path_relativ(%u) = %.*S", path_relativ_len, path_relativ_len, path_relativ)
00833 
00834                 if (count == 0) count = st_size;
00835 
00836                 bool result = (U_SYSCALL(sendfile, "%d,%d,%p,%lu", out_fd, fd, poffset, count) == (ssize_t)count);
00837 
00838                 U_RETURN(result);
00839                 }
00840

00848 
00849         static bool mkdirs(const char* path, mode_t mode = PERM_DIRECTORY);
00850 
00851         // If path includes more than one pathname component, remove it, then strip the last component
00852         // and remove the resulting directory, etc., until all components have been removed.
00853         // The pathname component must be empty...
00854 
00855         static bool rmdirs(const char* path, bool remove_all = false);
